caseName: Kauai Springs, Inc. v. Planning Commission
caseNameFull: KAUAI SPRINGS, INC., Appellant-Appellee v. PLANNING COMMISSION OF the COUNTY OF KAUAI, Appellee-Appellant

opinions.snippet: Opinion of the Court by GINOZA, J. This secondary agency appeal addresses whether Appellant Planning Commission of the County of Kauai (Planning Commission) properly denied Appellee Kauai Springs, Inc.’s (Kauai Springs) combined application for a Use Permit, a Class TV Zoning Permit, and a Special Permit to continue operating a spring water bottling facility on land zoned for agricultural use.

caseName: In re Adoption of Sheryl
court: Supreme Court of The Virgin Islands

opinions.snippet:
FEUERZEIG, Judge
MEMORANDUM OPINION
Nellie A. H., the maternal grandmother of Sheryl Patricia H., has filed a petition for adoption of her grandchild. Ms. H., a native of St. Kitts, West Indies, was born on June 18, 1932. Thus, she is 45 years old. The adoptee, Sheryl H., was born May 11, 1968, also in St. Kitts, and is 9 years old.

caseName: Hughes v. State
caseNameFull: Treva Lanan HUGHES, Appellant, v. the STATE of Oklahoma, Appellee
court: Court of Criminal Appeals of Oklahoma

opinions.snippet:
OPINION

CHAPEL, Judge:
On August 2, 1990, Appellant, Treva La-Nan Hughes, while intoxicated, drove her vehicle into oncoming traffic and collided with another vehicle. The driver of the other vehicle, Reesa Poole, was nine months pregnant and expected to deliver in four days. The collision caused Poole’s stomach to hit the steering wheel of her car with such force that the steering wheel broke.
